newsitem.title: POLAND: Pli acquires bathroom ceramics maker.
newsitem.headline: Pli acquires bathroom ceramics maker.

text.p: A consortium led by Polish Life Improvement SA (PLI) bought from the state treasury on Monday a 75 percent stake in Cersanit-Krasnystaw SA bathroom ceramics maker, the treasury ministry said in a statement.
The ministry said PLI SA retailer and wholesaler would take 62.5 percent of Cersanit and a company controlled by Cersanit employees 12.5 percent, paying jointly 24 million zlotys.
The consortium also pledged to invest further 25 million zlotys over the next three years and to maintain Cersanit's current employment of 762 for the next three years.
Cersanit based in Krasnystaw, eastern Poland, is one of Poland's leading manufacturers of ceramic bathroom equipment.
The remaining 20 percent would be set aside for all Cersanit employees and five percent for a planned fund to meet claims to property taken under communism.
